questions.question: What is the correct order of heading tags from most important to least important?
options: h1 to h6, where h1 is most important and h6 is least important
h6 to h1, where h6 is most important and h1 is least important
Only h1 and h2 are used

questions.question: Which of the following tags is used to emphasize text and is typically displayed in italics?
questions.explanation: The <em> tag is used to emphasize text and is typically displayed in italics. The <strong> tag is for strong emphasis (bold), and <span> is a generic inline container.

questions.question: Which tag is used for strong emphasis and is typically displayed in bold?
questions.explanation: The <strong> tag is used for strong emphasis and is typically displayed in bold. While <b> also makes text bold, <strong> has semantic meaning indicating importance.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the <span> tag?
options: To group or style inline text
questions.explanation: The <span> tag is an inline container used to group or style text. It doesn't have any visual effect by itself but is useful for applying CSS or JavaScript to specific portions of text.

questions.question: Which tag is used to create a horizontal separator line?
questions.explanation: The <hr /> tag is a self-closing tag used to create a horizontal rule (separator line) in HTML.

questions.question: Which of the following are inline tags that can be used within other elements?
questions.explanation: <span>, <em>, and <strong> are inline tags that can be used within other elements (like paragraphs) to style or emphasize specific portions of text.
